titles.title: Broadcast Ownership Stability Act of 1987
A bill to require the Federal Communications Commission to repromulgate certain regulations prohibiting trafficking in station licenses except when ownership is sought by minorities.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

term.name: Minorities in the mass media industry

bill.summary: 5/20/1987--Introduced. Broadcast Ownership Stability Act of 1987 - Requires the Federal Communications Commission to repromulgate its rules requiring a broadcast license to be held for three years before any transfer, with an exception for transfers to members of minority groups.
